objects.description:
As a user who uses a password on my phone, I would like to be able to unlock the screen in one step by entering the password instead of unlocking the screen and then needing to enter the password in order to save time during the unlock process.

Prerequisites: A passcode has been enabled in the Phone Lock settings
objects.name: [Lock Screen] Passcode unlock after phone has been asleep

steps.expected: The phone goes to sleep
steps.instruction: Allow the phone to go to sleep based on the sleep settings

steps.expected:
A slide bar shows. 
User should have to swipe to unlock and then enter the passcode. 

Only the passcode entry dialog should be present upon waking the phone.
steps.instruction: Wake the phone and observe the Lock Screen

objects.description:
As a user who uses a password on my phone, I would like to be able to unlock the screen in one step by entering the password instead of unlocking the screen and then needing to enter the password in order to save time during the unlock process.

Prerequisites: A passcode has been enabled in the Phone Lock settings
objects.name: [Lock Screen] Passcode unlock after phone has been restarted

steps.expected: Once the phone has restarted the lock screen should ask for a passcode. The lock screen should display the passcode form. The user should not have to swipe to unlock before entering their passcode in.
steps.instruction: restart the phone, once the phone has restarted observe the lock screen

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to set an alarm using a selected audible tone without vibration.

steps.expected: Clock App opens to page with current time with alarm icon in upper right

steps.instruction: Tap field beneath time

steps.expected: Desired alarm time displays

steps.expected: Alarm time updated on New Alarm page
steps.instruction: Tap OK

steps.expected: Select screen displays with options On and Off - with On highlighted and with a blue checkmark

steps.expected: Off is highlighted with a blue checkmark
steps.instruction: Tap Off

steps.expected: New alarm page displays with Off as default selection beneath Vibrate
steps.instruction: Tap OK

steps.expected: Current time with alarm icon in upper right with alarm set time below at the bottom of page
steps.instruction: Tap Done in upper right

steps.expected: The alarm should trigger - an on screen notification should be present and an audible alarm should trigger without vibrating.

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to set an alarm using a vibration with no audible tone so that I can configure how I want to be alerted in different scenarios.

steps.instruction: Set an alarm for the future - for the notification set an alarm that only uses vibration as the alert.

No Sound

Gem Echoes

Shimmering Waves
Into the Void
Smooth Strings


The vibrate options are: 
On
Off

objects.description:

steps.expected: The entered text reverts to "Sugg."

objects.description:

steps.expected: The text "Alpha" is entered

steps.expected: Auto Correction is undone leaving the characters "Alph". The Auto Correction blue highlighting is no longer present in the Word Suggestion bar

steps.expected: A space is entered after the characters "Alph"

steps.expected: The "Alpha." will be displayed.

objects.description:
Test case created for [Bug 846092] (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=846092)

PREREQUISITES:
1. Go to Settings >> Sound and ensure that Keypad is checked.
2. Press the volume up/down rocker to set the volume to the loudest possible.
objects.name: [Dialer] Adjust volume of keypad using the volume up/down rocker when entering number to dial

steps.expected: The dialer app opens.
steps.instruction: Open "dialer" app.

steps.expected: The phone pad shows up.
steps.instruction: Click on the phone pad icon on the bottom-right.

steps.expected: The volume is at its loudest.
steps.instruction: Type a number once (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: The volume is lower than before (less loud).
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring down the volume. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: The volume is much lower than before (less loud).
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring down the volume just above mute. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: There is no sound.
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring down the volume to mute. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: There is a sound.
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring up the volume from mute. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: The volume is much higher than before (louder).
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring up the volume. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

steps.expected: The volume is at its loudest.
steps.instruction: Press the volume up/down rocker to bring up the volume to maximum. Type the same number again (for example, "6") and note the loudness of the volume.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 859185 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=859185

PREREQUISITES:
 Address book has a contact stored with phone number that is not an exact match for the dialed number. For example, John Doe 26857419.
objects.name: [Dialer] Dialed number should show contact on calling screen only if contact number is an exact match

steps.expected: The dialer app opens.
steps.instruction: Open "dialer" app.

steps.expected: The phone pad shows up.
steps.instruction: Tap on the phone pad icon on the bottom-right.

steps.expected: John Doe's contact number should match and show up on the dialer app's phone pad.
steps.instruction: Type the first seven digits of the contact's phone number. For example, type "26857419" where "2685741" are the first 7 digits of John Doe's number.

steps.expected: John Doe's name and contact number should not be displayed on the call connecting screen. Only the dialed number should be displayed.
steps.instruction: Tap the green Dial button.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 871930 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=871930

PREREQUISITES: Address book has a contact stored with phone number and photo. For example, John Doe 26857419.
objects.name: [Dialer] When calling a contact, show the contact name, phone type and phone number dialed

steps.expected: The dialer app opens.
steps.instruction: Open "dialer" app.

steps.expected: The phone pad shows up.
steps.instruction: Tap on the phone pad icon on the bottom-right.

steps.expected: John Doe's contact number should match and show up on the dialer app's phone pad.
steps.instruction: Type the first four digits of the contact's phone number. For example, type "2685" where "2685741" are the first 4 digits of John Doe's number.

steps.expected: John Doe's name, matching contact number, phone type (if available), photo   (if available) and the carrier/phone notes (if available) should be displayed on the call connecting screen. (See screenshot attached.)
steps.instruction: Tap on the matching contact's information. For example, John Doe 26857419.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 839363 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=839363

PREREQUISITES: 
1. You must know the emergency telephone number in your country. For example, US: 911, Europe: 112, Brazil: 190 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emergency_telephone_number
2. There is a SIM Card in your phone.
3. Wifi is enabled on the phone.
objects.name: [Dialer] Possible to dial the emergency phone number when in airplane mode

steps.expected: Cellular connection and Wifi get turned off. An airplane icon is displayed in the status bar.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings and enable Airplane mode.

steps.expected: The dialer app opens.
steps.instruction: Open "dialer" app.

steps.expected: The phone pad shows up.
steps.instruction: Tap on the phone pad icon on the bottom-right.

steps.expected: Cellular connection and Wifi get turned on. The airplane icon is no longer displayed in the status bar. While the call is connecting, the text "Emergency Number" is displayed.
steps.instruction: Type the emergency number for your country (for example, "911" in the US). Tap the Dial button.

objects.description:
Test case has been disabled per bug 925055

Test case created for Bug 862711 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=862711

PREREQUISITES: 
1. The SD Card in the phone should have at least one music file copied on it.
2. A laptop connected to the phone via USB cable should have about 20 music files available on it for copying to the phone's SD Card.
objects.name: [Music} Scanning for new music files resumes if interrupted by USB cable plug - unplug

steps.expected: The Music app opens and scans the SD Card for music loaded on it.
steps.instruction: Launch the Music app.

steps.expected: The Music app plays the song.
steps.instruction: Tap on any song in the tile view to play it.

steps.expected: The Settings page updates to show a blue check sign next to Enable USB Storage and shows the text "Enabled".
steps.instruction: Go to Settings and enable USB storage.

steps.expected: The Music app stops playing the song and displays the warning "Music can not be used while phone is plugged in. Unplug the phone to play music."
steps.instruction: Plug in the USB cable from the laptop to the phone.

steps.expected: The Music app starts scanning the new music files added to the SD Card. The Music app eventually displays all the songs on the SD Card, new and old.
steps.instruction: Transfer about 20 music files from the laptop to the phone. After the transfer is complete, unplug the USB cable from the phone.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 830210 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=830210

PREREQUISITES:  
The phone's SD Card should have at least one music file.
objects.name: [Music] A song's rating can be changed to zero by tapping on the stars to toggle them on / off

steps.expected: The Music app opens and scans the SD Card for music loaded on it.
steps.instruction: Launch the Music app.

steps.expected: The Music app plays the song.
steps.instruction: Tap on any song in the tile view to play it.

steps.expected: All the stars up to the tapped star are toggled on.
steps.instruction: When the song starts playing, tap on any of the stars.

steps.expected: All the stars are toggled on.
steps.instruction: Tap the last (fifth) star.

steps.expected: The  last (fifth) star is toggled off.
steps.instruction: Tap the last (fifth) star again.

steps.expected: All the stars up to the tapped star stay toggled on but all stars after the tapped star are toggled off.
steps.instruction: Tap a star in the middle (any star except the first and the last).

steps.expected: The  tapped star is toggled off.
steps.instruction: Tap the star in the middle again.

steps.expected: The tapped (first) star stays toggled on but all stars after the tapped (first) star are toggled off.
steps.instruction: Tap the first star.

steps.expected: The  tapped (first) star is toggled off, thus returning the song to zero rating.
steps.instruction: Tap the first star again.

objects.description:
Test case created for Bug 877313 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=877313

PREREQUISITES:
The phone's SD Card should have at least three music files: one with a very short duration (less than 10 seconds), one with about 4 minutes duration and the third with more than 24 hours duration.
objects.name: [Music] When a song plays, the progress bar indicator moves to the right and stops when the song ends at the end

steps.expected: The Music app opens and scans the SD Card for music loaded on it.
steps.instruction: Launch the Music app.

steps.expected: The Music app plays the song.
steps.instruction: Tap on any song in the tile view to play it.

steps.expected:
The progress bar indicator moves to the right as the song plays. The elapsed time on the left starts from 00:00 while the remaining time shows the full duration of the song (for example, 00:10). 
(See screenshot attached.)
steps.instruction: Note the movement of the progress bar indicator (scrubber) when the song is playing.

steps.expected:
The progress bar indicator has moved to the extreme right when the song has completed playing but does not overlap with the remaining time indicator.The elapsed time on the left  shows the full duration of the song (for example, 00:10) while the remaining time shows --:--. 
(See screenshot attached.)
steps.instruction: Note the placement of the progress bar indicator (scrubber) when the song has completed playing.
